required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The UTHealth Medical-Legal Partnership: Improving Health by Addressing Health-Harming Legal Needs
clinical_study.official_title: The UTHealth Medical-Legal Partnership: Improving Health by Addressing Health-Harming Legal Needs

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the acceptability, feasibility, and preliminary effectiveness of the UTHealth medical-legal partnerships (MLP) against usual care.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who had an emergency department visit

arm_group.description: The Medical-Legal Partnership Group are lawyers in clinics who address health-harming legal needs. This group will also have access to access to a social worker and a community worker.
Access to a social worker and a community worker, but no systematic process for addressing health-harming legal needs.

intervention.intervention_name: Access to the Medical-Legal Partnership Group
intervention.description: The Medical-Legal Partnership Group are lawyers in clinics who address health-harming legal needs.

intervention.intervention_name: Access to social worker and a community worker
intervention.description: Access to social worker and a community worker, but no systematic process for addressing health-harming legal needs.

study_pop.textblock: These are adults patients accessing primary care clinics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- English- or Spanish- speaking
- screen positive for health-harming legal needs (HHLNs)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those unable or unwilling to consent to legal services

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
